description: Civitas Tropaensium was a Roman castrum settled by Roman veterans of the Dacian Wars. Constantine I rebuilt the city after it was destroyed by the Goths and it survived until the Avars sacked it in A.D. 587.

history.comment: removed connection to unpublished Civitas Tropaensium

GeoNames:686688

names.description: Dates following the Epigraphische Datenbank Heidelberg.
names.details: A fourth century A.D. (ca. 315 to 317) dedicatory inscription from Moesia Inferior, now housed in the Capitoline Museums in Rome, that attests to the name of the settlement. The inscription was discovered at Adamclisi in 1893.

provenance: Barrington Atlas: BAtlas 22 E4 Tropaeum Traiani
